metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000222 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Libgd version 2.2.5 contains a Double Free Vulnerability vulnerability in gdImageBmpPtr Function that can result in Remote Code Execution . This attack appear to be exploitable via Specially Crafted Jpeg Image can trigger double free. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in after commit ac16bdf2d41724b5a65255d4c28fb0ec46bc42f5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.10
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.10
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2 leosilva> code not present in precise/esm

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.10').
